poem:
**The Art of the Deal**

At Turnberry, the wind murmurs over greens,  
blades slice cleanly through morning air.  
A bunker of words, sand-trapped diplomacy—  
Two figures cast shadows by the North Sea.  
"Get your act together," a cry against turbines,  
each gust a negotiation; a golf ball spins,  
hopeful it will land on fair ground.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump tells Europe to ‘get your act together’ on immigration before US-EU trade talks Intensive negotiations were continuing on Saturday between the EU and the US before a crunch meeting in Scotland between Donald Trump and the European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, to avert a costly trade war. Trump spent the night at his family-owned Turnberry golf resort on a private visit, but took time to criticise European leaders over wind turbines and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
